## Major Pre-reqs {.unnumbered}

-   ACC 200: Principles of Accounting
-   IS 201: Introduction to Management Information Systems

One course from the following list:

-   ACC 310: Principles of Accounting 2
-   **ECON 110: Economic Principles and Problems** (starting in 2026, Econ 110 will be a required pre-req. In 2025 any course from this list will be accepted)
-   FIN 201: Principles of Finance
-   GSCM 201 & GSCM 211
-   IS 303: Introduction to Computer Programming
-   MKTG 201: Marketing Management
-   STAT 121: Principles of Statistics

## Minor Pre-reqs {.unnumbered}

-   ACC 200: Principles of Accounting
-   ECON 110: Econ Principles & Problems
-   FIN 201: Principles of Finance (starting in 2026, this pre-req will be replaced by IS 201: Introduction to Information Systems. For 2025, either course will be accepted\*)

*If you apply using IS 201 in 2025 you must email [Lisa Giguere](mailto:lisa_giguere@byu.edu) so she can substitute this for FIN 201 in your application.

## Junior Year for Majors {.unnumbered}

All newly admitted students enroll in the following courses their Junior year:

### Fall Semester {.unnumbered}

-   STRAT 326: Career Development (1.0 credit)
-   STRAT 401: Strategy 1 (3.0 credits)
-   STRAT 402: Strategy Analytics (3.0 credits)
-   STRAT 431: Strategic Thinking (1.5 credits)

Students who have not yet completed ECON 110 or STATS 

**Students interested in applying for one of the three [Product Management capstone experiences](02-capstone.qmd#product-management-experiences) should also enroll in one of:**

-   STRAT 490R: Creating Digital Products with AI: Strategy & Prototyping (3.0 credits)
-   MSB 341: Product Management (3.0 credits)

AND

-   MSB 342: Product Management Lecture Series (1.0 credit)

Students seeking to do either the Associate Product Manager (APM) Internship or Crocker Innovation Fellowship (read about all three [Product Management capstone experiences](02-capstone.qmd#product-management-experiences)) will **apply for these during Fall semester** 

Students interested in doing the [Sandbox capstone experience](02-capstone.qmd#sandbox) will apply for that during **Winter** semester.

All other students will complete the Business Analyst capstone experience their senior year while taking STRAT 421: Strategy Implementation. No separate application is required for the Business Analyst capstone experience.

Each student completes a single capstone experience by the time they graduate.

### Winter Semester {.unnumbered}

-   STRAT 411: Strategy II (3.0 credits)
-   STRAT 412: Strategy Analytics II (3.0 credits)
-   STRAT 432: Strategic Thinking II (1.5 credits)

Fall or Winter Semester Year 2 - STRAT 421: Strategy Implementation (3.0 credits) - STRAT 433: Strategic Thinking III (1.0 credits)

Additional Elective Requirements Students also complete three electives to allow them to customize their path in addition to the core business requirements.

Students interested in doing the [Sandbox capstone experience](02-capstone.qmd#sandbox) will apply during Winter semester of their Junior year.

<script>
  function computeCredits(containerId) {
    const staticCourses = document.querySelectorAll(`#${containerId} li`);
    const elective = document.querySelector(`select.elective[data-target="${containerId}"]`);
    const electiveCredits = elective && elective.value ? parseFloat(elective.dataset.credits || 0) : 0;
    const staticTotal = Array.from(staticCourses).reduce((sum, li) => sum + parseFloat(li.dataset.credits || 0), 0);
    return staticTotal + electiveCredits;
  }

  function updateAllCredits() {
    const ids = ["junior-fall", "junior-winter", "senior-fall", "senior-winter"];
    let total = 0;
    ids.forEach(id => {
      const credits = computeCredits(id);
      document.getElementById(`${id}-total`).textContent = credits.toFixed(1);
      total += credits;
    });
    document.getElementById("total-program-credits").textContent = total.toFixed(1);
  }

  // Initial load
  updateAllCredits();

  // Recalculate when electives change
  document.querySelectorAll("select.elective").forEach(select => {
    select.addEventListener("change", updateAllCredits);
  });
</script>
